The Last Jedi is the most complex story we have seen to date in the Star Wars saga. It breaks the white hat/black hat/light side/dark side formula that we\'ve come to expect. This is not another movie from my or your childhood. That
column53: is the problem for a vocal minority of fans who don\'t like TLJ. Without risking spoilers
column54: characters in TLJ do not act as we expect Star Wars heroes and villains to act. Instead of god-like and faultless heroes
column55:
we get failure and disappointment. The villains falter. Just keep in mind that one of if not the most important themes in Star Wars is redemption after the fall. This movie is filled with a lot of the latter and a bit of the former. Failure: dwell upon that notion and think about all of the Jedi masters we have encountered. Remember also that this is the middle of this trilogy\'s arc and that the heroes we see are not written as gilded statues but as real people with real flaws." End quote

This is a smug
column122: charmless mess of a movie that sets new lows for screenwriting arrogance and incompetence. TLJ is paradoxically too clever for its own good and also profoundly stupid. A few visual masterstrokes can\'t redeem glaring plot holes or shallow
column123:
underdeveloped characters.

column124: especially in the service of a lazy low-stakes story. If a franchise feels compelled to destroy a cherished character it should at least be for a believable reason
column125:
not because the writer\'s a creatively-bankrupt nihilist.

Throughout this insipid slog writer/director Rian Johnson exhibits sneering contempt for the audience
column127: and every single one of his [vastly superior] creative predecessors. This film will leave even the most casual Star Wars fans

The numerous failings and flaws of this film have been pointed out so many times in the other audience reviews here
column148:
but I feel compelled to speak on a few issues nonetheless:

A). About "fanboys": Don\'t dismiss them. Star Wars created fanboys and fanboys are largely responsible for creating the Star Wars blockbuster phenomenon that has lasted for over 40 years. I was 10 years old when Star Wars (A New Hope) first hit theaters
column149: and up to now its goodwill has carried me through
column150: many times groaning (especially with the prequels)
column151: but never perturbed as I am now. As I suspect it may be for many
column152:
the Last Jedi is the last straw.

Maybe it is a conscious act by Rian Johnson to kill the past. He certainly seems to be enamored with his own genius in "giving us the Star Wars we needed" as opposed to what we wanted. It seems
column154: that he was so busy trying to subvert expectations that he failed to produce a coherent script. Ultimately
column155: Johnson opted to throw the baby out with the bathwater
column156: summarily dismissing 40 years of Star Wars legacy and lore to prove his own brilliance in giving us something unexpected and new. Well
column157: my expectation that the movie would at least honor the Star Wars legacy was certainly subverted
column159: many people feel the same way. Johnson
column160:
Kathleen Kennedy and the TPTB at Disney should not be surprised if by "killing the past" they also end up killing the goodwill the brand has carried for decades.

B) WTF plot points that haven\'t been discussed enough:
The story is essentially two battles book-ending Rey\'s long weekend with grumpy grandpa Luke
column161: with everybody else literally trying to keep busy until that is out of the way. And the best Johnson could come up with is a slow chase in space? I
column163: wonder whether he ever saw a Star Wars movie before. Its not just the fanboys and geeks in this camp either
column164:
as his script defies basic logic on its own. Set aside that this chase takes place in an established universe where hyperspace travel exists and ships have different speed and weapons capabilities - the absurdity of it all is still highlighted by inconsistent developments in the plot. To wit:

So Admiral Holdo\'s big
column165: top secret plan is to limp along until they can all sneak out on transports
column166: go to Crait and use the base to call their friends for help. And in the middle of this
column168: a known friend of the Resistance
column169:
without anyone on his own ship let alone the First Order being the wiser...

OK
column170: maybe Maz was too busy with her union troubles to forward a message
column171: but did Leia or Holdo not at least contemplate trying to get on the horn with someone they knew? Instead
column172: they sit on their hands while Finn and Rose go on their excellent adventure for 18 hours
column173:
using a transport to hyper jump away - again without anyone on their own ship or the FO even noticing...

Hey
column174: maybe Leia or Holdo or someone else with some juice could have gone to Canto Bight or somewhere to use a pay phone there. Or better yet
column175: they could have tried to get as many VIPs out on all those other transports
column176:
that are capable of hyper space travel and no one seems to notice...

Except for DJ. Who somehow knows Holdo\'s plan

column178:
who wouldn\'t have been there in the first place if they were in any way privy to said plan...

PURE

Top 10 Things We Know After Watching Star Wars: The Last Jedi...

1. Released Dec 2017. Any critic giving a positive review because a film is \'visually stunning\' should be ASHAMED. This isn\'t 1993\'s Jurassic Park. This is 2017/18. We can make CGI stormtroopers on our phones!
2. Disney decided to use multiple directors for a Star Wars trilogy (seemingly without the two communicating)
column191:
and overall theme is just boring...
3. There is now gravity in space! Resistance fighters have to DROP bombs directly over the First Order ships
column192: and ships slow down when they run out of fuel. Obviously
column193:
long ago in a galaxy far away the vacuum of space had gravity.
4. Slap stick comedy is now rampant in the Star Wars Universe. Return of the Jedi can now be digitally remastered again!! The force ghosts appearing at the celebration after the Battle of Endor can be played by Larry
column195:
and Mo!
5. John Williams still has it! One star for John Williams.
6. People can survive the vacuum of space! When opening the bomb bays of the WWII style bomber ships
column196: and when sucked out of an exploded bridge of a resistance ship in the worst Peter Panning moment in cinematic history people survive in space. I mean
column197:
space has gravity so it might as well have atmosphere as well..
7. "This is Hollywood. No one cares if a move is good as long as it makes money!" --Mark Hamill
8. This film did have editors\' names listed in the credits. No one is really sure what they actually did
column198:
though...
9. Star Wars has produced the largest fan base of any movie series--one that has spanned 40 years
column200: and made billions in merchandise sales. Disney and this director who shall not be named decided to \'kill the past\' and \'go in a different direction\'
column202:
wait......Why did they do that?
10. The audience has spoken. Ep. 8 is the worst Star Wars move ever! As annoying as Jar Jar Binks was
column203: Ep. 1 brought us a terrific Jedi scene. The Last Jedi has no redeeming qualities. ']
